summary: The document details the employment and payroll records of William Brown, a Senior Investigator for the JFK Task Force, under the Assassination Records Review Board. It includes his salary, position, and the recommendation for his employment based on his extensive experience in criminal investigation. The document also contains standard payroll and leave record forms, with partial information release postponement due to the inclusion of Social Security numbers, considered an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. This reflects the historical interest in JFK assassination-related documents and the careful handling of sensitive information.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document's release was due to the inclusion of Social Security numbers, protecting personal privacy.
William Brown was recommended for a Senior Investigator position at a $24,000 annual salary, acknowledging his criminal investigation expertise.
The document exemplifies standard payroll authorization and leave record procedures within the U.S. House of Representatives.
It highlights the historical significance and sensitive nature of documents related to the JFK assassination.
